p: Furthermore, in eukaryotes, both leaflets of the PM contain specific lipid compositions. The outer leaflet of the PM contains mostly PtdCho and SLs. The inner leaflet, in contrast, involves PtdEtn, the negatively charged PtdSer, and PtdIns [ 49]. This membrane asymmetry is created and maintained by two types of ATP-driven pumps: flippases and floppases [ 50, 51, 52]. A rapid collapse of these pumps, called phospholipid scrambling, externalizes PtdSer allowing it to exert its effector role in many cell activities, for instance, the phagocytic clearance of apoptotic bodies and blood coagulation [ 53, 54, 55, 56, 57, 58] (and reviewed in [ 59]).
